title: Update from response

author: Anna Katharina Strandgaard
text: I bought a coat on Vestiaire. Everything went as it should, until my package was out for delivery, but wasn’t for some unknown reason. I tracked it through their app, but the status of the package stayed unchanged. After about two weeks I contacted Vestiaire to ask about the package, but I didn’t get an answer. I then contacted the courier, and was told my package was lost, and they couldn’t find it. After I talked to the courier my package status on the Vestiaire app updated and said it was delivered. I then contacted them again, saying the courier told me the package was lost, so how was it possible that they could change the status. Instead of looking into it they wanted me to send a handwritten letter confirming I never received it. They even wanted my neighbors to write one. And this is in spite off the delivery address wasn’t even my address but a courier parcel box. After sending the mail with all the requested information I never heard anything back from them. A couple of weeks went by, and I received a text from the courier saying they found my package. When picking it up the package was soaked and ruined, and the coat I ordered was sticking out. I then, again, contacted Vestiaire with pictures of the package. Again, they informed that I had to send them a handwritten letter confirming this statement. I did as asked, and haven’t heard a word back since, except from their automated email saying “We’ve not forgotten you - we’ll be in touch in the next 24(or 72) hours.” I’ve since contacted them again and again, but still - and as expected - no answer. This is absolutely the worst customer service! Don’t use their site. If anything happens, you won’t ever hear a word back from them.
title: Worst customer service!

author: HB
text:
The worst ever customer service - avoid at all costs. I received an item that was sizes smaller than advertised but they refused to refund the item. title: The worst ever customer service

author: Jerri Roberts
text:
If I could rate a 1/4 of a Star, that would sum up my feelings about the incomplete, magical rules, and Nazi like behavior, I would!!
Let’s just start with “Banning” These ppl monitor their site with some keyword platform that will auto ban you for a minimum of 24 hours!  Don’t even think about calling Customer Service, because they can’t or won’t help you. 
You will get the usual VC Lies! IE; “This will be reviewed immediately by our upper management”, etc. 
Complaint #2 If your order stated that it’s delivered, but it’s really not; you’re screwed. If you get sent something that looks and feels fake, you have 3 days from day of delivery to get any piece in question authenticated by a jeweler, PLUS, Have their findings in an official report! (Yeah Right; like we have the time?” Aren’t WE THE BUYERS? Why aren’t the Seller’s Responsible for this?
Complaint #3
I ordered 5 really discounted Bvlgari BZero1 Womens watches before December 2021. Some had plain colored faces, and others had Mother of Pearl faces. 
Please note that I previously bought a MOP face on this site, and there were Zero Issues.
This time, they stated that “Pearls” were being banned from import, so I wasn’t allowed to purchase the Mother of Pearl watches! I was livid!!! I explain to everyone under the sun that a Pearl and Mother of Pearl were two completely different items. They did the usual, “I’ll be more than happy to fix this for you” LIE!!!
They canceled my orders that contains Mother of Pearl watches that were supposed to be Christmas Gifts. 
I have so many more complaints, and very little nice things to say about VC. I ended up getting so pissed off that I deleted my account and my husbands account. DELETING MINE AND HUBBY’S ACCOUNTS ONLY EASY PART OF DEALING WITH VC. 
They Are Incompetent on Every Level, and IF you delete your account, don’t expect them to reopen it for you. That’s another lie I’ve been told. They are “Working on reopening my account. After it goes up the Chain of Command”.
I’ve been waiting for WEEKS! Don’t Bother!
title: If I could rate a 1/4 of a Star

author: Tee
text:
You are better off selling your items on ebay or hardlyeverwornit.

I sold a dress recently, downloaded the prepaid label and posted it. When I tracked it, it was delivered and Vestaire said it was not on their network. I sent proof of postage, my ID card and every information requested, but I was told they couldn't find it.

It's frustrating because I have be passed around, asked to send the same proof multiple time and still they do not want to hold themselves or their partnering courier company (Evri) responsible.

I have read horrible reports here, but still went ahead using them. For the commissions they charge, you would expect a better process and better courier company process. Please sell off your items elsewhere, use PayPal and document proof. Because, you would be out off pocket if there is any problem

Thank God I have not bought any item here, because the buyers review here is horrible. Use farfetch, I had a better experience there.
title: Avoid, Because if your Parcel is Lost or Has Any Issues Using Their Prepaid Label, they will not Refund Neither will Their Partner Courier Company

author: Louisa Parkin
text: Don’t use this dreadful company. I only wish I had read the reviews first. Awful customer service, everything is automated, they don’t know what is going on most of the time, contradicting each other and providing out of date or conflicting information. They also send you fake messages to say the seller is about to reduce the price of the item, even though they have no intention of doing so. author: Zara
text:
Ridiculous £15 'authentication' fees and insanely high delivery fees, even for items sold in your own city! 

The high price would be understandable if the delivery service they choose (Evri - Hermes rebrand - enough said!) was not so abysmal. 

Additionally, Evri felt it was appropriate to give me an hour's notice that they would make a delivery between 6-8pm... on a Friday night! Lucky me getting to sit at home waiting for a parcel after a long day's work. They claim that they set the ETAs in the morning and I saw that they had my parcels in their depot last night and at 6 am this morning...Why leave notifying me to the late afternoon??

They claim to be green and yet they do not let you avoid their ridiculous authentication service when buying goods from abroad. This not only costs you more money (on top of customs and delivery fees), but forces you to have the parcels shipped to more locations! Not very environmentally friendly. 

Awful customer service that wastes your time trying to get you off their back rather than actually giving good service. They do not want to claim responsibility. Please, might I suggest that you take a leaf out of Amazon's book - they know a bit about good service.

There are so many more things I wanted to buy from VC, but you have lost a customer.
title: Ridiculous £15 'authentication' fees…
